pj2y6.question: In flight below 2000 feet RA, on an ILS Autopilot approach with flare armed, what happens if you push a TO/GA switch once?

options.text: Autothrottle advances thrust levers to reduced Go-Around N1.
Autothrottle will disengage, and ARM is dispalyed in FMA.
Autothrottle advances thrust levers to full Go-Around N1.
Autopilot will disengage, and CWS P will annunciate.

9zplq.question: After takeoff the autothrottle will remain in Throttle Hold (THR HLD) until 800 feet RA.

p0n3ij.question: Which Statements are correct?
firstCorrectStatements: The A/T automatically disengages approximately 2 seconds after touchdown.
firstIncorrectStatements: The A/T must be manually disengaged after touchdown.
secondCorrectStatements: The A/P must be manually disengaged after touchdown.
Landing roll-out is executed manually after disengaging the A/P.
secondIncorrectStatements: The A/P  automatically disengages approximately 2 seconds after touchdown.
Landing roll-out is executed automatically by the A/P.
p0n3ij.explanation:
- The A/T automatically disengages approximately 2 seconds after touchdown.
- the A/P must be manually disengaged after touchdown. Landing roll-out is executed manually after disengaging the A/P.

1xqfd.question: What components make up the Automatic Flight System (AFS)?

options.text: Flight directors, MCP mode selector system, autothrottles.
Autopilot, MCP mode selector system, autothrottles.
Autothrottles and autopilot flight director system.
AFDS, MCP mode selector system, autothrottles.

d4ajt.question: What normally provides the N1 limits and target N1 values to the Autothrottle?

options.text: The Electronic Engine Controls (EECs).
The Flight Management Computer.
The Autothrottle Computer.
The Flight Control Computers.

ej35u.question: What does an illuminated green light mean in the MCP buttons?

options.text: That mode is currently engaged and active.
The switch is available to be selected.
That mode is currently de-selected and inactive.
That switch can be de-selected.

ckmye.question: If you engage Level Change by pressing the LVL CHG switch on the MCP and the green light illuminates, what other indications will occur as this mode engages?

options.text: Speed window blanks, MCP SPD annunciated for pitch mode, N1 annunciated for thrust mode.
Speed window blanks, MCP SPD annunciated for pitch mode, N1 or RETARD/ARM annunciated for thrust mode.
Speed window opens to show target speed, MCP SPD annunciated for thrust mode, N1 annunciated for pitch mode.
Speed window opens to show target speed, MCP SPD annunciated for pitch mode, N1 or RETARD/ARM annunciated for thrust mode.

qle8m.question: In flight, with Autopilot engaged in CMD B, which FCC controls the logic for the flight directors on the Captain's PFD.

options.text: FMS A
FMS B
FCC A
FCC B

k7n04i.question: The VOR/LOC mode must be armed before the second Autopilot can be selected during a duel channel autopilot approach.

inr4c.question: What does a flashing "A" displayed to the left of the selected MCP speed indicate?

options.text: Underspeed limiting, FMC speed or MCP selected speed cannot be reached.
limiting for maximum speed for current flap setting.
Overspeeed limiting at Mmo limit
Overspeed limititing at Vmo Limit

92zjsg.question: An altitude restriction is entered at the top of descent, the aircraft will not now follow the Idle Descent path but will descend to meet the altitude restriction.  After achieving the altitude restriction which of the indicated flight paths will the aircraft follow for the rest of the decent?

options.text: Descends to achieve restriction then maintains level flight until intercepts the original idle descent path. (A)
Descends to achieve restriction, then continues steady descent to End of Descent. (C)
None of the options
Descends to achieve restriction then descends at 1000 fpm until intercepting original idle descent path. (B)

bg4q.question: In the IAS/MACH Display, to the left of the displayed figure, what does a flashing "A" indicate?

options.text: Underspeed limiting, FMC or selected speed can not be reached.
Underspeed limiting, Vmo or Mmo limit.
Overspeed limiting, current speed selection greater than current flap setting limit.
Overspeed limiting, Minimum speed for current flap setting cannot be achieved.

q7mz7.question: For approach, what altitude must the second Autopilot be selected for duel Autopilot operation?

options.text: 1500 feet RA
500 feet RA
350 feet RA
800 feet RA

f1n1e.question: The autopilot automatically disengages 2 seconds after touchdown.

q09vx.question: Below which RA should FLARE mode be armed during AUTOLAND?

options.text: 350 feet RA.
50 feet RA.
350 feet AGL.

lfnln.question: If an altitude restriction is entered before TOD, the aircraft will commence the descent early to follow a new idle descent path to achieve the descent restriction.  If ALT INTV is then selected after the descent restriction, which of the paths will the aircraft follow?

options.text: Path A.  Descends to achieve restriction then maintains level flight until intercepts the original idle descent path.
Path C.  Descends to achieve restriction, then continues steady descent to End of Descent.
Path D.  Descends to achieve restriction, then continues on that new idle descent path until new commands are entered.
Path B.  Descends to achieve restriction then descends at 1000 fpm until intercepting original idle descent path.

yqw1u.question: With VNAV engaged, pushing the SPD INTV switch has what effect?

options.text: IAS/MACH window blanks and next FMC speed restriction becomes active, magenta target speed displayed above speed tape on PFD.
IAS/MACH window opens up showing current FMC target speed, and IAS/MACH selector can be used to set new desired speed.
Current or next speed restriction deleted from FMC, IAS/MACH window opens up showing previous FMC target speed, and IAS/MACH selector can be used to set new desired speed.
No effect, VNAV remains enagaged with the FMC controlling target speed.

z9m0v.question: The N1 limits and target N1 values are normally provided to the Autothrottle from where?

options.text: Autothrottle Computer.
Electronic Engine Control Computers.
Flight Management Computer.
Flight Control Computers.

cvckr.question: At what altitude will the FLARE manoeuvre start during AUTOLAND?

options.text: 50 feet AGL.
50 RA.
350 feet RA.
500 feet AGL.

bi3qf.question: Why do we check that FLARE mode is armed at 500 feet RA?

options.text: To allow start of the flare manoeuvre at 350 feet RA.
To allow APP mode to be selected at this point if FLARE not armed.
To be aware that A/P will disengage at 350 feet RA if not armed.
To allow the second A/P to be engaged at this point.

vkkce.question: Other than by selecting N1 mode by pressing the N1 switch on the MCP, when else will N1 mode automatically engage.

options.text: LVL CHG and VNAV engaged within first 2.5 minutes after takeoff.
Never, N1 mode is only ever manually selected and engaged.
LVL CHG engaged in climb more than 2.5 minutes after takeoff.
VNAV engaged in climb and LVL CHG engaged in climb more than 2.5 minutes after takeoff.

q19qn.question: What happens when TO/GA is pressed once on an ILS Autopilot approach with FLARE armed?

options.text: Autothrottle advanced the thrust levers to full Go-Around thrust.
The autothrottle disengages and THR HLD annunciates in the FMA.
Autopilot disengages and the Flight Directors re-cycle to give a FD Go-Around.
Autothrottle advanced the thrust levers to reduced Go-Around N1.

keer8.question: After takeoff, the Autothrottle remains in Throttle Hold (THR HLD) until 800 feet RA.

4aslyl.question: The VOR/LOC mode must be armed before the second Autopilot can be selected during a duel channel Autopilot approach.

295jk.question: What are the components of the Automatic Flight System (AFS)?

options.text: Autopilot, Autothrottle, and MCP Mode Selection System.
Autopilot Flight Director System and Autothrottle.
Autopilot Flight Director System, Autothrottle and MCP Mode Selector System.
Flight Directors, Autothrottle, and MCP Mode Selection System

h7o24.question: What will cause the A/T to disengage?

options.text: Push Either A/T Disengage switch and Move A/T ARM switch to OFF
Push Either A/T Disengage switch and An A/T system fault is detected
Immediately the left main landing gear is compressed, Push Either A/T Disengage switch and Move A/T ARM switch to OFF.
Move A/T ARM switch to OFF, Push Either A/T Disengage switch and An A/T system fault is detected

1aypn.question: What are the indications for A/T disconnected.

options.text: A/T P/RST disenage light illuminates steady.
Tone sounds and A/T P/RST disengage light illuminates steady
A/T P/RST disengage light flashes.
Tone sounds and A/T P/RST disengage light flashes

6t3y5.question: The A/T is controlled by FCC A only.

ohr35.question: During THR HLD (Throttle Hold), if you manually move the throttle levers, the A/T will try to return them to their original position.

pr3g1.question: The Autothrottle (A/T) system, provides automatic thrust control from the start of takeoff, through all stages of flight to up to and including landing.

eqv1t.question: With A/T engaged, what condition could cause the throttles to be separated (not aligned).

options.text: One EEC in ON, one EEC in ALTN.
Throttle stagger cannot occur with A/T engaged as both throttle servo motors work identically to position the throttles symetrically.
Both EECs in ALTN.
One engine A/T suffering a system fault.
